problems.title: Binary Search - Find Element in Sorted Array
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You are given a sorted array of N integers and a target element X.
Using Binary Search (recursive approach), find if X exists in the array.
If found, print the index (0-based). If not found, print -1.

Binary Search works by repeatedly dividing the search space in half.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
5
1 3 5 7 9
5

Sample Output
2

Explanation:
Element 5 is found at index 2.
problems.constraints:
1 <= N <= 1000
-10000 <= arr[i] <= 10000
Array is sorted in ascending order

hintsList: Compare target with middle element. If equal, return mid. If target < mid, search left half. If target > mid, search right half.
Base case: if left > right, element not found, return -1.
